knimeNode.name: Date&Time-based Row Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: Filters rows according to a start and end time or range.

fullDescription.intro: Extracts all rows where the time value of the selected column lies within a given time window from the input. The time window is specified by a start and either an end date (and time), a period or duration or a numerical value combined with a granularity.

tab.name: Column Selection
tab.option: It will be filtered by the date/time of the selected column.

tab.name: DateTime Selection
tab.option: The start date (and time) determines the lower bound of the filter. It is only optional, i.e. if no start is defined, there is no lower bound.
Inserts the current time formatted according to the format and locale.
If checked, rows with a value equal to the start (or end) date will be kept in the output. If not checked, only rows with a value strictly later than start (or earlier than end) are kept.
If checked, the execution time will be used as filter value, i.e. every execution the current time will be inserted.
Optionally an end point or range can be chosen. If unchecked, there is no upper bound.
Select to insert an end date (and time) which determines the upper bound of the filter.

Select to insert a format string (defined by the ISO-8601 period format or duration format ) to use as filter range. All rows which are included in this range, will be in the output. A negative period or duration defines a range reaching back to the past.
Examples for Period:
"P2Y" parses as "+2 years"
"P-2Y" parses as "-2 years"
"P1Y2M3W4D" parses as "1 year, 2 months, 3 weeks and 4 days"
Examples for Duration:
"PT15M" parses as "+15 minutes"
"-PT15M" parses as "-15 minutes"
"PT2H15M3.5S" parses as "2 hours, 15 minutes and 3.5 seconds"

Select to insert an integer and a granularity to define a filter range. A negative value defines a range reaching back to the past. The granularity can be chosen in years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds, nanoseconds.
